items.title: Available Geometric Structures
items.content:
68: :label: rem-cg-geometric-inventory
69: 
70: The Crystalline Gas provides the following fundamental objects:
71: 1. **Two 3-vectors:** $F_i, p_i \in \mathbb{R}^{3}$ (assuming $d=3$ for Standard Model correspondence)
72: 2. **One unit vector:** $\hat{r}_{i,j^*(i)} \in S^{2}$
73: 3. **Two scalars:** $S_{\text{ascent}}, \Phi(x_i) \in \mathbb{R}$
74: 
75: From these, we will construct:
76: - **8-component object** for SU(3): via tensor product $F \otimes p$

items.label: rem-cg-su3-physical
items.title: Physical Interpretation of SU(3) Structure
items.content:
252: :label: rem-cg-su3-physical
253: 
254: The SU(3) color structure emerges naturally because:
255: 
256: 1. **Tensor product structure:** $F \otimes p$ is a rank-2 tensor in 3D space, naturally living in the adjoint representation of SU(3)
257: 
258: 2. **Traceless condition:** Removing the trace projects from U(3) to SU(3), ensuring no overall "baryon number" charge
259: 
260: 3. **8 gluons:** The 8 independent components of $T^{\text{traceless}}$ correspond exactly to the 8 gluons: $(r\bar{g}, r\bar{b}, g\bar{b}, \ldots)$
261: 
262: 4. **Coupling strength:** The amplitude $\rho_i = \|F\| \cdot \|p\|$ gives the **strong coupling constant**:
263: 
264: $$
265: g_s \propto \|F\| \cdot \|p\| \propto \|\nabla \Phi\| \cdot \|v\|
266: $$

items.label: rem-cg-su2-nonabelian
items.title: Non-Abelian Structure of SU(2)
items.content:
386: :label: rem-cg-su2-nonabelian
387: 
388: The SU(2) field strength tensor includes the crucial **commutator term**:
389: 
390: $$
391: W_{\mu\nu}^a = \partial_{\mu} W_{\nu}^a - \partial_{\nu} W_{\mu}^a + g_2 \varepsilon^{abc} W_{\mu}^b W_{\nu}^c
392: $$
393: 
394: where $g_2$ is the weak coupling constant and $\varepsilon^{abc}$ is the Levi-Civita symbol.
395: 
396: The $\varepsilon^{abc}$ structure arises geometrically from the **curl of the direction vector**:
397: 
398: $$
399: \partial_{\mu} \hat{r} \times \partial_{\nu} \hat{r} = \sum_{abc} \varepsilon^{abc} (\partial_{\mu} \hat{r}^b)(\partial_{\nu} \hat{r}^c) \hat{e}_a
400: $$

items.label: rem-cg-u1-alternative
items.title: Alternative: U(1) from Companion Distance
items.content:
497: :label: rem-cg-u1-alternative
498: 
499: An alternative construction uses the **distance to companion** $d_{i,j^*(i)}$ instead of fitness:
500: 
501: $$
502: \varphi_i^{(Y)} := g_A\left(\frac{d_{i,j^*(i)} - \langle d \rangle}{\sigma_d}\right) + \eta
503: $$
504: 
505: where $g_A(z) = 2/(1 + e^{-z})$ is the logistic rescaling function from the Fragile Gas.
506: 
507: This has the advantage of being **geometrically distinct** from the SU(2) structure (which uses direction, not distance), more closely mirroring the Fragile Gas construction.

items.label: rem-cg-vs-standard-model
items.title: Comparison to Standard Model
items.content:
557: :label: rem-cg-vs-standard-model
558: 
559: The Crystalline Gas gauge group matches the **electroweak sector of the Standard Model**:
560: - SU(3)_c: Quantum Chromodynamics (strong nuclear force)
561: - SU(2)_L: Weak isospin (weak nuclear force, chiral)
562: - U(1)_Y: Hypercharge (electroweak unification)
563: 
564: The photon and Z boson arise from electroweak symmetry breaking (mixing of $W_{\mu}^3$ and $A_{\mu}^{(Y)}$), which would require extending to the Higgs sector (not needed for the mass gap proof).

items.label: rem-cg-cmi-verification
items.title: Relation to CMI Problem Statement
items.content:
832: :label: rem-cg-cmi-verification
833: 
834: The Clay Mathematics Institute problem asks for:
835: 
836: 1. **A mathematically rigorous construction of a four-dimensional Yang-Mills theory** satisfying the Wightman axioms (or equivalent Osterwalder-Schrader axioms)
837: 
838: 2. **A proof that the theory has a mass gap** $\Delta > 0$ in the spectrum
839: 
840: We have now established:
841: - ✅ **Gauge group:** SU(3)_c × SU(2)_L × U(1)_Y (product of compact simple groups)
842: - ✅ **Gauge fields:** Rigorously constructed from algorithmic quantities
843: - ✅ **Pure gauge theory:** Noether current vanishes at QSD
844: - ✅ **Yang-Mills equations:** Satisfied at equilibrium
845: 
846: The remaining steps are:
847: - Verify Osterwalder-Schrader axioms (requires checking correlation functions)
848: - Prove spectral gap (Section 5)
